definition: to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: Because in traditional Chinese's view, if you do not have house you won't have a real family.
sentences.chinese: 中国人的传统观念在作祟，就是有房才有家。

sentences.english: This, then, is the spectre that haunts the Democrats.
sentences.chinese: 这就是作祟与民主党黑人总统的幽灵。

sentences.english: Unable to bear lonely past, a light rain began work, calm and stable.
sentences.chinese: 耐不住往昔的落寞，小雨开始作祟，从容而淡定。

sentences.english: Some female girl thought it was the bear demon, a proposal please mage to drive the demon.
sentences.chinese: 一些女丫头以为是熊妖作祟，有人提议请法师来驱妖。

sentences.english: As of now, experts believed it is a genetic mutation.
sentences.chinese: 目前，专家初步判定，这是“生存基因”作祟。
只不过她的占有欲又在作祟而已。

sentences.english: Greedy for power, the general plotted a plan to knock down the government.
sentences.chinese: 因为权欲作祟，将军密谋推翻政府。

sentences.english: I had enrolled in the seminar out of sheer curiosity.
sentences.chinese: 我加入这研讨会纯粹出于好奇心的作祟。

sentences.english: This, again, is greed at play.
Perhaps it's the Celt in me.
sentences.chinese: 也许是我身上凯尔特人的性格在作祟。

definition: (of a ghost) to make strange things happen/to act up/to act behind the scenes/to make mischief/odd/to misbehave (euphemism for having sex)
to trace something to its source (idiom)
to get to the heart of the matter
to urge/to prompt/to spur on/to order sb about
